Detailed Description

Frame widget implementation.

Copyright (C) 2009 - 2010 Atmel Corporation. All rights reserved.

Definition in file wtk_frame.c.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum wtk_frame_state

Valid states for frame, relevant to pointer and keyboard operations.

For internal use only.

Enumerator:
WTK_FRAME_NORMAL 

Normal state, no moving or resizing.

WTK_FRAME_AWAITING_MOVE 

Waiting for move, from key or drag.

WTK_FRAME_MOVING 

Currently moving.

WTK_FRAME_AWAITING_RESIZE 

Waiting for resize, from key or drag.

WTK_FRAME_RESIZING 

Currently resizing.

Definition at line 109 of file wtk_frame.c.

Function Documentation

static void wtk_continue_drag ( struct win_point const *  last_pos,
struct win_point const *  pos 
) [static]

This function updated the drag target handle graphics. Call this function from the MOVE event handler of the dragging widget. This function needs both the current position and the last used position. The last position will be either the position handed to wtk_start_drag() or the "pos" parameter of the last call to wtk_continue_drag(). The pointer event struct will keep this value for you. No need to store it yourself.

Parameters:
last_pos Last position.
pos Current position.

static void wtk_handle_frame_move ( struct wtk_frame *  frame,
struct win_pointer_event const *  event 
) [static]

This function is a helper function for the wtk_frame_handler() function. It is called when a pointer MOVE event is sent to the container window. This function either starts or continues a drag operation, depending on current state.

Parameters:
frame Frame the received the event.
event Pointer event information.

static void wtk_handle_frame_release ( struct wtk_frame *  frame,
struct win_pointer_event const *  event 
) [static]

This function is a helper function for the wtk_frame_handler() function. It is called when a pointer RELEASE event is sent to the container window. This function completes the move operation if the RELEASE event was inside the parent window's boundaries.

Parameters:
frame Frame the received the event.
event Pointer event information.

static bool wtk_is_drag_threshold_exceeded ( struct win_point const *  pos  )  [static]

This function compares a given position with the drag origin prepared by the wtk_prepare_drag() function. If either the X or Y distance exceeds the WTK_DRAG_THRESHOLD value, this function returns true. That is when the widget event handler should call wtk_start_drag().

Parameters:
pos Position to compare.
Returns:
True if threshold exceeded.

Definition at line 489 of file wtk_frame.c.

References wtk_drag_origin, and WTK_DRAG_THRESHOLD.

Referenced by wtk_handle_frame_move(), and wtk_handle_resize_move().

static void wtk_prepare_drag ( struct win_point const *  pos  )  [static]

This function prepares for a drag operation. No drag is started yet, but the drag origin is stored. To start a drag operation, one would repeatedly check if the drag threshold is exceeded, then call the wtk_start_drag() function.

Parameters:
pos Pointer position for drag origin.

Definition at line 471 of file wtk_frame.c.

References wtk_drag_origin.

Referenced by wtk_handle_frame_press(), and wtk_handle_resize_press().

static void wtk_resize_frame ( struct wtk_frame *  frame,
struct win_area const *  contents_area 
) [static]

This function is a helper function used when creating a frame widget and when handling resize events. Given a new size for the contents window, it resizes and rearranges the windows composing the frame so that the frame decorations are properly sized and positioned.

Parameters:
frame Frame to resize.
contents_area New size for the contents window.

Definition at line 407 of file wtk_frame.c.

References wtk_frame::container, wtk_frame::contents, win_area::pos, wtk_frame::resize, win_area::size, WIN_ATTR_POSITION, WIN_ATTR_SIZE, win_get_area(), win_set_area(), WTK_FRAME_BOTTOMBORDER, WTK_FRAME_MIN_HEIGHT, WTK_FRAME_MIN_WIDTH, WTK_FRAME_RESIZE_HEIGHT, WTK_FRAME_RESIZE_WIDTH, WTK_FRAME_RIGHTBORDER, WTK_FRAME_SHADESIZE, WTK_FRAME_TITLEBAR_HEIGHT, and WTK_FRAME_TOPBORDER.

Referenced by wtk_frame_create(), and wtk_handle_resize_release().

static void wtk_start_drag ( struct win_point const *  pos  )  [static]

This function starts the drag operation. It will allocate memory to store the screen behind the drag handles and draw the handles themselves. Do not call this function unless wtk_prepare_drag() has been called first with the drag origin position. If there is not enough memory, this function will no draw anything, but it is still safe to call wtk_continue_drag() and wtk_stop_drag().

Parameters:
pos Current position of drag target.

Definition at line 510 of file wtk_frame.c.

References gfx_draw_filled_circle, gfx_get_height(), gfx_get_pixmap, gfx_get_width(), gfx_set_clipping(), GFX_WHOLE, membag_alloc(), membag_free(), WTK_DRAG_HANDLE_RADIUS, wtk_drag_origin, WTK_DRAG_ORIGIN_COLOR, wtk_drag_origin_pixmap, WTK_DRAG_PIXMAP_SIZE, WTK_DRAG_TARGET_COLOR, and wtk_drag_target_pixmap.

Referenced by wtk_handle_frame_move(), and wtk_handle_resize_move().

static void wtk_stop_drag ( struct win_point const *  last_pos  )  [static]

This function stops an ongoing drag operation. Do not call this unless dragging has been started with wtk_start_drag() first. This function erases the drag handles and frees any allocated memory.

Parameters:
last_pos Last position, as for wtk_continue_drag().

Definition at line 612 of file wtk_frame.c.
